summary: This is an email exchange between an FBI agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding overseas victim notifications related to Jeffrey Epstein's release. It discusses the status of notifications to victims in Bogota and Australia, and mentions a Bank of America employee facing difficulties for contacting the FBI about a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR), which may involve attorney Alan D and Br Stns.

persons.name: Alan D
persons.context: Mentioned as potentially being more involved than Epstein in the context of a Bank of America employee's difficulties regarding a Suspicious Activity Report.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the victim notifications; his release is the reason for the notifications being sent.

connections.description: Implied connection as an attorney potentially involved in matters concerning Epstein, specifically related to a Suspicious Activity Report.

events.title: Overseas Victim Notifications
events.description: Email exchange regarding the status of victim notifications to individuals in Bogota and Australia following Jeffrey Epstein's release.

keyFacts: The document is an email from December 4, 2008, concerning victim notifications related to Jeffrey Epstein's release.
Notifications were being sent to victims in Bogota and Australia, with confirmation that the Bogota notification was being delivered.
A Bank of America employee faced 'grief' for contacting the FBI about a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR), which may involve attorney Alan D and Br Stns more than Epstein.
The email is from an FBI agent to an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach, Florida.
